info.title: Bitcoin API Free with On-Chain data BTC
info.description:
OpenApi Bitcoin style   ReDoc Bitcoin style

Subscriptions

Unlock higher request limits and access to additional datasets with a subscription.
üëâSubscription BGeometrics

Usage Guidelines
  • The access token can be sent as a URL parameter (?token=...) or in the header: Authorization: Bearer <token>
  • Example: https://bitcoin-data.com/v1/sopr
  • Example with the token: https://bitcoin-data.com/v1/cdd?token=XXX
  • Date format: YYYY-MM-DD (applies to day, startday, endday) https://bitcoin-data.com/v1/mvrv?startday=2025-01-01&endday=2025-01-07
  • Pagination: use the 'page' and 'size' parameters to paginate.
  • Free plan: up to 8 requests per hour and 15 requests per day.

Latest update

  • API endpoints for Bitcoin derivatives: Basis, Open Interest, Funding Rate, Global Futures, and Taker metrics. Updated hourly
  • Export csv file.
  • Data Stocks: Gold, Google, Nvidia, Meta, Strategy, Apple, Tesla.
  • BTC Technical Indicators: RSI, MACD, SMA, EMA...
  • Data cryptos:
  •    Ethereum (ETH), Binance Coin (BNB), Solana (SOL), Ripple (XRP), Cardano (ADA), Dogecoin (DOGE), Toncoin (TON), Avalanche (AVAX), Chainlink (LINK)
  •    Stellar (XLM), Litecoin (LTC), Polkadot (DOT), Monero (XMR), Uniswap (UNI), Bitcoin Cash (BCH), Shiba Inu (SHIB), Algorand (ALGO), Filecoin (FIL)
  •    Cosmos (ATOM), Ethereum Classic (ETC), XDC Network (XDC), Hedera (HBAR), NEAR Protocol (NEAR), VeChain (VET), Tezos (XTZ), NEM (XEM), Internet Computer (ICP), Stacks (STX), Injective (INJ)

tags.name: ETF BTC
tags.description: The daily flows and aggregates of Bitcoin of the ETF, Blackrock (IBIT), The Grayscale Bitcoin Trust (GBTC), Fidelity (FBTC), Ark Invest /21Shares (ARKB), Bitwise (BITB), Franklin (EZBC), Investco / Galaxy (BTCO), Vaneck (HODL), Valkyrie (BRR) and Wisdomtree (BTCW).

tags.name: Hodl Waves Supply
tags.description: HODL Waves Supply is an on-chain metric that analyzes the length of time bitcoins have remained unmoved, offering insights into the accumulation and distribution habits of Bitcoin holders.

tags.name: Cryptos
tags.description:
Crypto: Cosmos (ATOM), Ethereum Classic (ETC), XDC Network (XDC), Hedera (HBAR), NEAR Protocol (NEAR), VeChain (VET), Tezos (XTZ), NEM (XEM), Internet Computer (ICP), Stacks (STX), Injective (INJ). 

Crypto2: Stellar (XLM), Litecoin (LTC), Polkadot (DOT), Monero (XMR), Uniswap (UNI), Bitcoin Cash (BCH), Shiba Inu (SHIB), Algorand (ALGO), Filecoin (FIL). 

Crypto3: Cosmos (ATOM), Ethereum Classic (ETC), XDC Network (XDC), Hedera (HBAR), NEAR Protocol (NEAR), VeChain (VET), Tezos (XTZ), NEM (XEM), Internet Computer (ICP), Stacks (STX), Injective (INJ).

tags.name: Difficulty Btc
tags.description: Difficulty: how difficult it is to find a hash below the target compared to the minimum difficulty of the system.

tags.name: Realized Price
tags.description: Bitcoin Realized Price is the average price at which bitcoins were bought/spent/transferred.

tags.name: BTC Terminal Price
tags.description: Export BTC Terminal Price data as CSV.

tags.name: NRPL
tags.description: Bitcoin NRPL (Net Realized Profit Loss). It measures BTC of profit or loss realized by bitcoin holders over last day. The NRPL indicator compares the selling price of coins to their acquisition price (based on the last time they were moved).

tags.name: Realized Cap
tags.description: Bitcoin Realized Capitalization

tags.name: NUP
tags.description: Net Unrealized Profit (NUP) is the sum of products of UTXO's value and the price difference between created and destroyed only in profit, divided by market_cap.

tags.name: Open Interest
tags.description: Open Interes 1h. Total number of open futures or perpetual contracts that have not yet been closed or settled at that time on BTC. Updated hourly. Open Interes Futures. Bitcoin futures and options contracts in circulation on the market.

tags.name: BTC Technical Indicators
tags.description: Bitcoin Technical Indicators: rsi, macd, macdsignal, macdhist, sma7, sma50, sma200, ema7, ema50, ema200

tags.name: Stablecoin Supply
tags.description: The circulation of these stablecoins, usdt, usdc, dai, busd, gusd and pax.

tags.name: Coins Address
tags.description: Bitcoin Coins by Address (or Coins by Address Balance) refers to the total amount of BTC held in addresses whose balance falls within a certain range of BTC.

tags.name: MVOCDD
tags.description: Median Value of Coin Days Destroyed

tags.name: MVRV
tags.description: Bitcoin Market Value Realized Value

tags.name: Miner Balances
tags.description: Mining balance of the last 30 days in BTC.

tags.name: Investor Cap
tags.description: It is estimates the cost-basis valuation of Bitcoin holders, specifically focusing on long-term or ‚Äúsmart money‚Äù investors

tags.name: Hodl Waves
tags.description: HODL waves are the percentage of bitcoins based on how long ago they were purchased.

tags.name: Derivatives Basis 1H
tags.description: The basis is the difference between the price of futures contracts and the spot market price of Bitcoin. Basis > 0 (contango), the futures price is higher than the spot price. This indicates market optimism (traders expect BTC to rise). Basis < 0 (backwardation), the futures price is below the spot price. This indicates pessimism or high selling pressure in derivatives.

tags.name: Taker Buy Sell Volume 1H
tags.description: who immediately executes the order in the Bitcoin order book. Updated hourly.

tags.name: Market Cap
tags.description: Market capitalization data for Bitcoin (BTC). Market Cap is calculated by multiplying the current price of Bitcoin by the total number of Bitcoins in circulation.

tags.name: NUPL
tags.description: Bitcoin Net Unrealized Profit Loss. It represents investor sentiment and shows what Bitcoin holders would gain or lose if they sold now. ‚Ä¢ NUPL STH (Short-Term Holder). Coins less than 155 days old. STH in unrealized gain or loss ‚Ä¢ NUPL LTH (Long-Term Holder). Coins with age >= 155 days. LTH in unrealized gain or loss

tags.name: Hashribbons
tags.description: Bitcoin Hash Ribbons is a market indicator that uses Bitcoin's hash rate data to identify potential buying opportunities during miner capitulation periods.

tags.name: BTC Profit / Loss
tags.description: Percentage of BTC that is profitable, meaning the acquisition price is higher than today's price.

tags.name: Funding Rate
tags.description: It is an interest rate that is periodically paid between traders of perpetual futures contracts to balance out price differences between futures contracts and the spot market.

tags.name: Futures Global 1H
tags.description: Measures the proportion of accounts (traders) that hold long positions versus short positions in Bitcoin futures. Updated hourly.

tags.name: HashPrice
tags.description: Hashprice es una m√©trica que mide cu√°nto dinero gana un minero por cada TH/s (terahash por segundo) de potencia de minado por d√≠a

tags.name: Puell Multiple
tags.description: Bitcoin Puell Multiple is calculated by dividing the daily issuance value of bitcoins (in USD) by the 365-day moving average of the daily issuance value.

tags.name: NVTS
tags.description: Dynamic Range NVT Signal is Bitcoin's price-to-earnings (PE) ratio, which is derived by dividing the market capitalization by the dollar value of on-chain transactions.

tags.name: Open Interest
tags.description: Open Interes 1h. Total number of open futures or perpetual contracts that have not yet been closed or settled at that time on BTC. Updated hourly. Open Interes Futures. Bitcoin futures and options contracts in circulation on the market

tags.name: Stocks
tags.description: Gold, Silver, SP500, Strategy, Microsoft, Meta, Google, Apple, Amazon and Nvidia

tags.name: True Market Mean
tags.description: Bitcoin True Market Mean Price (TMMP) is the ratio of realized market capitalization to active supply.

tags.name: BTC Issued
tags.description:
BTC Issued, the daily sum of new BTC issuance per block mined. 

BTC Iss Cont Pct Ann is an on-chain metric that indicates what percentage the bitcoin supply grows per year due to the issuance (mining) of new BTC.

tags.name: Hashrate
tags.description: Hashrate is the amount of computing power being used on the network to mine and validate blocks.

tags.name: MVRV
tags.description: Bitcoin Market Value Realized Value is the relationship between Market Value and Realized Value ‚Ä¢ MVRV STH (Short-Term Holder). Coins less than 155 days old.    MVRV STH > 1: Short-Term Holders are in profit. Typical area of ‚Äã‚Äãselling pressure.    MVRV STH < 1: Short-Term Holders are at a loss. Historically local capitulation zones. ‚Ä¢ MVRV LTH (Long-Term Holder). Coins with age >= 155 days.    MVRV LTH > 1: Long-Term Holders are structurally profitable.    MVRV LTH < 1: Long-Term Holders are losing money.

tags.name: SOPR
tags.description: Compare the selling price of a UTXO to its value when it was acquired. SOPR = Selling price of BTC / Purchase price of the BTC spent. ‚Ä¢ SOPR STH (Short-Term Holder). Coins less than 155 days old.    SOPR STH > 1: STHs sell for profit.    SOPR STH < 1: STHs sell for loss. ‚Ä¢ SOPR LTH (Long-Term Holder). Coins with age >= 155 days.    SOPR LTH > 1: Long-Term Holders sell for profit.    SOPR LTH < 1: Long-Term Holders sell for loss.

tags.name: UTXOs
tags.description:
UTXO count, the total number of unspent transaction outputs existing at a specified day. 

 UTXOs In Loss, the number of UTXOs that are in loss. 

UTXOs In Loss (%), the percentage of the number of UTXOs that are in loss. 

UTXOs In Profit (%), the percentage of the number of UTXOs that are profitable

tags.name: Addresses
tags.description: Activate Addresses, the total number of unique active addresses, inclusive of senders and receivers. Active Sender Addresses, the total number of unique active sender addresses. Active Receiver Addresses, the total number of unique active receiver addresses. NVM (Network Value to Metcalfe Ratio) is the ratio between the logarithm of the market capitalization divided by the logarithm of daily active addresses.

tags.name: Bitcoin Dominance
tags.description: Bitcoin Dominance is a crypto market indicator that measures what percentage of the total value of all cryptocurrencies corresponds to Bitcoin.

tags.name: Thermo Cap
tags.description: It is the cumulative revenue earned by Bitcoin miners.

tags.name: Bitcoin Price
tags.description: ‚Ä¢ BTC Price USD ‚Ä¢ BTC Price OHLC Open, High, Low and Close. ‚Ä¢ Delta Price (%) is the price change between two specific points in time, in this case, one day and the previous day. Delta Price (USD) = Current Price ‚àí Previous Price ‚Ä¢ Sharpe Ratio measures risk-adjusted return. It is the ratio of Annualized Return to Annualized Volatility (Standard Deviation of Daily Returns multiplied by sqrt(364)). A Sharpe ratio < 0 means:    High risk    Low return    Capital is not being efficiently rewarded Historically:    Sharpe > 1 ‚Üí good    Sharpe > 2 ‚Üí excellent    Sharpe < 0 ‚Üí hostile environment for passive strategies. ‚Ä¢ Sortino Ratio is a financial metric that measures the return on investment adjusted for downside risk (negative volatility). A Sortino ratio < 0 means:    Low return    Capital is not being efficiently rewarded Historically:    Sortino > 1 ‚Üí good    Sortino > 2 ‚Üí excellent    Sortino < 0 ‚Üí hostile environment for passive strategies

tags.name: ASOL
tags.description: The Average Lifespan of Spent Output (ASOL) measures the average age of recently spent Bitcoin outputs. ASOL focuses exclusively on these lifetimes, without considering transaction volume, to measure the age of coins circulating on the network.

tags.name: Realized Loss
tags.description: Losses on bitcoin transactions that were bought and sold

tags.name: Top Trader
tags.description: Top Trader Long Account 1H. How the largest accounts (the ‚Äútop traders‚Äù) are positioned in the BTC futures market. Updated hourly. Top Trader Position 1H. Top Traders Long/Short Positions for Bitcoin, they refer to how the largest accounts (‚Äútop traders‚Äù) are positioned in the futures market. Updated hourly.

tags.name: VDD
tags.description:
Value Destroyed Days combines Coin Days Destroyed (CDD) with the price to measure how much "old economic value" is moving on the network. VDD = (BTC √ó age in days) x USD Price. 

VDD Multiple (Value Days Destroyed Multiple) then divides a 30-day average of VDD by a 365 average to compare near-term spending velocity with a yearly average of spending velocity.

tags.name: Realized Profit
tags.description: Profits on bitcoin transactions that were bought and sold

tags.name: Reserve Risk
tags.description: Bitcoin Reserve Risk. Current Price of Bitcoin / Cumulative Opportunity Cost (HODL Bank)

tags.name: VOCDD
tags.description: Value of Coin Days Destroyed

tags.name: Bitcoin Supply
tags.description: Bitcoin Supply is the amount of BTC that exists. Long-Term Holder Supply (LTH Supply) is an on-chain metric that measures how much Bitcoin is held by long-term investors. LTH Supply is the total amount of BTC whose last transaction occurred more than 155 days ago. Short-Term Holder Supply (STH Supply) is an on-chain metric that measures how much Bitcoin is held by short-term investors. STH Supply is the total amount of BTC whose last transaction occurred less than 155 days ago. Supply Loss, the amount of BTC that is in loss. Supply Profit, the amount of BTC that is in profit.

tags.name: NUL
tags.description: Net Unrealized Loss (NUL) is the sum of products of UTXO's value and the price difference between created and destroyed only in loss, divided by market_cap.

tags.name: Balance Address
tags.description: Bitcoin Balance by Address refers to the number of Bitcoin addresses that have a balance within a certain range of BTC.

tags.name: AVIV
tags.description: Active Value to Investor Value. The AVIV Ratio compares Bitcoin's active capitalization (i.e., the portion of BTC in circulation that is in motion‚Äîrecent transactions, withdrawals from exchanges, etc.) with its realized capitalization (historical BTC value based on when it was acquired).

tags.name: CDD
tags.description:
Coin Days Destroyed (CDD) is the sum of the product of the number of coins spent and the number of days those coins were inactive before being spent, calculated for all coins spent on a given day. 

Supply Adjusted Coin Days Destroyed (CDD) is CDD value adjusted by supply. It is calculated as the value of CDD divided by total supply. 

Binary Coin Days Destroyed is binary value and if Supply Adjusted Coin Days Destroyed (Supply-Adjusted CDD) is larger than average Supply-Adjusted CDD, Binary Coin Days points to '1' and points to '0' if not.

tags.name: Realized Cap
tags.description: Cumulative valuation of all bitcoins at the price they were last moved, providing a more accurate representation of market value than traditional market cap.

tags.name: Investor Price
tags.description: Export Investor Price data as CSV.
